verses.kjv: Now concerning the things whereof ye wrote unto me: It is good for a man not to touch a woman.
verses.web: Now concerning the things about which you wrote to me: it is good for a man not to touch a woman.
verses.ct: Now, about the matters you wrote to me about: it's good for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless, to avoid fornication, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.
verses.web: But, because of sexual immoralities, let each man have his own wife, and let each woman have her own husband.
verses.ct: But because of the danger of sexual sin, each man should have his own wife, and each woman should have her own husband.

verses.kjv: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise also the wife unto the husband.
verses.web: Let the husband give his wife the affection owed her, and likewise also the wife her husband.
verses.ct: A husband should fulfill his wife's sexual needs, and a wife should do the same for her husband.

verses.kjv: The wife hath not power of her own body, but the husband: and likewise also the husband hath not power of his own body, but the wife.
verses.web: The wife doesn’t have authority over her own body, but the husband. Likewise also the husband doesn’t have authority over his own body, but the wife.
verses.ct: A wife doesn't have sole authority over her own body — her husband does too. In the same way, a husband doesn't have sole authority over his own body — his wife does too.

verses.kjv: Defraud ye not one the other, except it be with consent for a time, that ye may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and come together again, that Satan tempt you not for your incontinency.
verses.web: Don’t deprive one another, unless it is by consent for a season, that you may give yourselves to fasting and prayer, and may be together again, that Satan doesn’t tempt you because of your lack of self-control.
verses.ct: Don't deprive each other, unless you both agree to do so for a set time so you can devote yourselves to fasting and prayer. Then come back together again, so that Satan doesn't tempt you through your lack of self-control.

verses.kjv: But I speak this by permission, and not of commandment.
verses.web: But this I say by way of concession, not of commandment.
verses.ct: I'm saying this as a concession, not as a command.

verses.kjv: For I would that all men were even as I myself. But every man hath his proper gift of God, one after this manner, and another after that.
verses.web: Yet I wish that all men were like me. However each man has his own gift from God, one of this kind, and another of that kind.
verses.ct: I wish everyone could be like me. But each person has their own gift from God — one person has this gift, another has that one.

verses.kjv: I say therefore to the unmarried and widows, It is good for them if they abide even as I.
verses.web: But I say to the unmarried and to widows, it is good for them if they remain even as I am.
verses.ct: To those who are unmarried and to widows, I say this: it's good for them to stay single, as I am.

verses.kjv: But if they cannot contain, let them marry: for it is better to marry than to burn.
verses.web: But if they don’t have self-control, let them marry. For it’s better to marry than to burn.
verses.ct: But if they can't control themselves, they should get married. It's better to marry than to burn with desire.

verses.kjv: And unto the married I command, yet not I, but the Lord, Let not the wife depart from her husband:
verses.web: But to the married I command—not I, but the Lord—that the wife not leave her husband
verses.ct: To those who are married, I give this command — and it's not just from me, but from the Lord: a wife must not leave her husband.

verses.kjv: But and if she depart, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband: and let not the husband put away his wife.
verses.web: (but if she departs, let her remain unmarried, or else be reconciled to her husband), and that the husband not leave his wife.
verses.ct: But if she does leave, she must either stay unmarried or reconcile with her husband. And a husband must not divorce his wife.

verses.kjv: But to the rest speak I, not the Lord: If any brother hath a wife that believeth not, and she be pleased to dwell with him, let him not put her away.
verses.web: But to the rest I—not the Lord—say, if any brother has an unbelieving wife, and she is content to live with him, let him not leave her.
verses.ct: To everyone else, I say this — and this is from me, not the Lord: if a brother has a wife who doesn't believe, and she's willing to stay with him, he shouldn't divorce her.

verses.kjv: And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he be pleased to dwell with her, let her not leave him.
verses.web: The woman who has an unbelieving husband, and he is content to live with her, let her not leave her husband.
verses.ct: And if a woman has a husband who doesn't believe, and he's willing to stay with her, she shouldn't leave him.

verses.kjv: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband: else were your children unclean; but now are they holy.
verses.web: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified in the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified in the husband. Otherwise your children would be unclean, but now they are holy.
verses.ct: The unbelieving husband is set apart as holy through his wife, and the unbelieving wife is set apart as holy through her husband. Otherwise your children would be unclean, but as it is, they are holy.

verses.kjv: But if the unbelieving depart, let him depart. A brother or a sister is not under bondage in such cases: but God hath called us to peace.
verses.web: Yet if the unbeliever departs, let there be separation. The brother or the sister is not under bondage in such cases, but God has called us in peace.
verses.ct: But if the unbelieving spouse leaves, let them go. The brother or sister isn't bound in that situation. God has called us to live in peace.

verses.kjv: For what knowest thou, O wife, whether thou shalt save thy husband? or how knowest thou, O man, whether thou shalt save thy wife?
verses.web: For how do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?
verses.ct: Wife, how do you know whether you'll save your husband? Husband, how do you know whether you'll save your wife?

verses.kjv: But as God hath distributed to every man, as the Lord hath called every one, so let him walk. And so ordain I in all churches.
verses.web: Only, as the Lord has distributed to each man, as God has called each, so let him walk. So I command in all the assemblies.
verses.ct: Each person should live the life the Lord has assigned to them, staying in the situation God called them into. This is the rule I lay down in every church.

verses.kjv: Is any man called being circumcised? let him not become uncircumcised. Is any called in uncircumcision? let him not be circumcised.
verses.web: Was anyone called having been circumcised? Let him not become uncircumcised. Has anyone been called in uncircumcision? Let him not be circumcised.
verses.ct: Was someone already circumcised when God called them? They shouldn't try to reverse it. Was someone uncircumcised when called? They shouldn't get circumcised.

verses.kjv: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.
verses.web: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.
verses.ct: Circumcision means nothing, and uncircumcision means nothing. What matters is keeping God's commandments.

verses.kjv: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called.
verses.web: Let each man stay in that calling in which he was called.
verses.ct: Each person should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.

verses.kjv: Art thou called being a servant? care not for it: but if thou mayest be made free, use it rather.
verses.web: Were you called being a bondservant? Don’t let that bother you, but if you get an opportunity to become free, use it.
verses.ct: Were you a slave when you were called? Don't let it trouble you. But if you get a chance to gain your freedom, take it.

verses.kjv: For he that is called in the Lord, being a servant, is the Lord’s freeman: likewise also he that is called, being free, is Christ’s servant.
verses.web: For he who was called in the Lord being a bondservant is the Lord’s free man. Likewise he who was called being free is Christ’s bondservant.
verses.ct: A slave who was called by the Lord is the Lord's free person. In the same way, a free person who was called is Christ's servant.

verses.kjv: Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men.
verses.web: You were bought with a price. Don’t become bondservants of men.
verses.ct: You were bought with a price. Don't become slaves to human masters.

verses.kjv: Brethren, let every man, wherein he is called, therein abide with God.
verses.web: Brothers, let each man, in whatever condition he was called, stay in that condition with God.
verses.ct: Brothers, whatever situation each person was in when God called them, they should stay in it with God.

verses.kjv: Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet I give my judgment, as one that hath obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.
verses.web: Now concerning virgins, I have no commandment from the Lord, but I give my judgment as one who has obtained mercy from the Lord to be trustworthy.
verses.ct: Now about those who have never married: I don't have a direct command from the Lord, but I'll give you my opinion as someone who has received the Lord's mercy and can be trusted.

verses.kjv: I suppose therefore that this is good for the present distress, I say, that it is good for a man so to be.
verses.web: Therefore I think that because of the distress that is on us, that it’s good for a man to remain as he is.
verses.ct: Because of the present crisis, I think it's best for a person to stay as they are.

verses.kjv: Art thou bound unto a wife? seek not to be loosed. Art thou loosed from a wife? seek not a wife.
verses.web: Are you bound to a wife? Don’t seek to be freed. Are you free from a wife? Don’t seek a wife.
verses.ct: Are you married? Don't seek a divorce. Are you unmarried? Don't look for a wife.

verses.kjv: But and if thou marry, thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin marry, she hath not sinned. Nevertheless such shall have trouble in the flesh: but I spare you.
verses.web: But if you marry, you have not sinned. If a virgin marries, she has not sinned. Yet such will have oppression in the flesh, and I want to spare you.
verses.ct: But if you do marry, you haven't sinned. And if a virgin marries, she hasn't sinned either. However, those who marry will face extra hardships in this life, and I'm trying to spare you from that.

verses.kjv: But this I say, brethren, the time is short: it remaineth, that both they that have wives be as though they had none;
verses.web: But I say this, brothers: the time is short, that from now on, both those who have wives may be as though they had none;
verses.ct: Here's what I mean, brothers: the time is short. From now on, those who have wives should live as though they don't;

verses.kjv: And they that weep, as though they wept not; and they that rejoice, as though they rejoiced not; and they that buy, as though they possessed not;
verses.web: and those who weep, as though they didn’t weep; and those who rejoice, as though they didn’t rejoice; and those who buy, as though they didn’t possess;
verses.ct: those who mourn, as though they aren't mourning; those who celebrate, as though they aren't celebrating; those who buy things, as though they own nothing;

verses.kjv: And they that use this world, as not abusing it: for the fashion of this world passeth away.
verses.web: and those who use the world, as not using it to the fullest. For the mode of this world passes away.
verses.ct: and those who deal with the things of this world, as though they aren't fully invested in them. Because this world in its present form is passing away.

verses.kjv: But I would have you without carefulness. He that is unmarried careth for the things that belong to the Lord, how he may please the Lord:
verses.web: But I desire to have you to be free from cares. He who is unmarried is concerned for the things of the Lord, how he may please the Lord;
verses.ct: I want you to be free from worry. An unmarried man focuses on the Lord's work and how to please the Lord.

verses.kjv: But he that is married careth for the things that are of the world, how he may please his wife.
verses.web: but he who is married is concerned about the things of the world, how he may please his wife.
verses.ct: But a married man focuses on worldly matters and how to please his wife.

verses.kjv: There is difference also between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman careth for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit: but she that is married careth for the things of the world, how she may please her husband.
verses.web: There is also a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit. But she who is married cares about the things of the world—how she may please her husband.
verses.ct: There's a difference between a married woman and a virgin. An unmarried woman focuses on the Lord's work, wanting to be holy in both body and spirit. But a married woman focuses on worldly matters and how to please her husband.

verses.kjv: And this I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a snare upon you, but for that which is comely, and that ye may attend upon the Lord without distraction.
verses.web: This I say for your own profit; not that I may ensnare you, but for that which is appropriate, and that you may attend to the Lord without distraction.
verses.ct: I'm saying this for your benefit, not to restrict you. I want to help you live in a way that's honorable and devoted to the Lord without distraction.

verses.kjv: But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of her age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.
verses.web: But if any man thinks that he is behaving inappropriately toward his virgin, if she is past the flower of her age, and if need so requires, let him do what he desires. He doesn’t sin. Let them marry.
verses.ct: If a man feels he's not treating his fiancée properly, and she's getting past the prime age for marriage, and he feels the pull is too strong — let him do what he wants. He isn't sinning. Let them get married.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in his heart, having no necessity, but hath power over his own will, and hath so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, doeth well.
verses.web: But he who stands steadfast in his heart, having no urgency, but has power over his own will, and has determined in his own heart to keep his own virgin, does well.
verses.ct: But the man who has firmly made up his mind, who isn't under pressure, who has control over his own desires, and who has decided in his heart to keep his fiancée as she is — that man does well.

verses.kjv: So then he that giveth her in marriage doeth well; but he that giveth her not in marriage doeth better.
verses.web: So then both he who gives his own virgin in marriage does well, and he who doesn’t give her in marriage does better.
verses.ct: So the man who marries his fiancée does well, but the man who doesn't marry her does even better.

verses.kjv: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.
verses.web: A wife is bound by law for as long as her husband lives; but if the husband is dead, she is free to be married to whomever she desires, only in the Lord.
verses.ct: A wife is bound to her husband as long as he lives. But if her husband dies, she's free to marry anyone she wants — as long as he belongs to the Lord.

verses.kjv: But she is happier if she so abide, after my judgment: and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.
verses.web: But she is happier if she stays as she is, in my judgment, and I think that I also have God’s Spirit.
verses.ct: But in my opinion, she'll be happier if she stays as she is. And I believe I also have the Spirit of God in saying this.
